description: '''Andrew Robert Nielsen''' (born October 6, 1982), known professionally as '''MC Lars''', is an American rapper, producer, educator, and founder of [[Horris Records]]. A graduate of [[Stanford University]] and the [[University of Oxford]], he is credited as a pioneer of "lit-hop", a genre blending hip-hop with themes from classical and American literature. He is also known for coining the term "[[iGeneration]]" in 2003, and has performed at venues including [[Carnegie Hall]] and multiple [[TEDx]] events. His work frequently references authors like [[William Shakespeare]], [[Edgar Allan Poe]], and [[Herman Melville]], and he is considered a key figure in the early [[nerdcore]] movement.
